name: simulate-whole-cell-ode-model
title: Simulate Whole-Cell ODE Model
description: Simulate a whole-cell model using ordinary differential equations (ODEs)
content:
Overview

This application simulates whole-cell models represented as systems of ordinary differential equations. Built using Biomni, it uses numerical integration to model cellular processes including transcription, translation, metabolism, and ATP dynamics.

Features

  • Multiple numerical integration methods (RK45, LSODA, BDF, etc.)
  • Default whole-cell model with mRNA, protein, metabolite, and ATP
  • Customizable initial conditions and parameters
  • Detailed simulation statistics and final state
  • CSV export of time-series results

Parameters

  • Initial Conditions: JSON with initial values (e.g., {"mRNA":1.0,"protein":0.5,"metabolite":2.0,"atp":5.0})
  • Parameters: JSON with model parameters (e.g., {"k_transcription":0.5,"k_translation":0.1,"k_mrna_deg":0.2,"k_protein_deg":0.1,"k_metabolism":0.3,"k_atp_production":0.4,"k_atp_consumption":0.05})
  • Time Start: Simulation start time
  • Time End: Simulation end time
  • Time Points: Number of evaluation points
  • Method: Integration method (LSODA, RK45, BDF, etc.)

Output

The application generates a CSV file with complete time-series results and a detailed research log with simulation statistics.

Use Cases

  • Systems biology modeling
  • Metabolic pathway simulation
  • Gene expression dynamics
  • Whole-cell computational models
command: rm -rf prod_apps 2>/dev/null || true && git clone https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git prod_apps && python "prod_apps/biomni/bioengineering/simulate_whole_cell_ode_model.py" '${initialConditions}' '${parameters}' --time-start ${timeStart} --time-end ${timeEnd} --time-points ${timePoints} --method ${method}

spec.name: initialConditions
spec.label: Initial Conditions (JSON)
spec.description: JSON object with initial values for state variables. Example: {"mRNA":1.0,"protein":0.5,"metabolite":2.0,"atp":5.0}

spec.name: parameters
spec.label: Model Parameters (JSON)
spec.description: JSON object with model parameters. Example: {"k_transcription":0.5,"k_translation":0.1,"k_mrna_deg":0.2,"k_protein_deg":0.1,"k_metabolism":0.3,"k_atp_production":0.4,"k_atp_consumption":0.05}

spec.name: timePoints
spec.label: Number of Time Points
spec.description: Number of time points to evaluate
